name: kickoff
content:
Add to word list
Add to word list
the time when a game of soccer starts, or when it begins again after it has stopped because of a goal, etc. See also
kick off (START)
informal the time when an activity starts
Thesaurus: synonyms, antonyms, and examples
the start of somethingbeginningLet's go back to the beginning. Can you tell me when you arrived at the crime scene?startI didn't like him from the very start.endThis is it – the end of the tour. openingThe opening of the ceremony was marred by protest.commencementWhat is the commencement date of their contract?kickoffWhat time is the kickoff for the banquet and show?

Add to word list
Add to word list
the time when a football game starts, or a kick of the ball that starts play during a game: [ U ] Kickoff is at 6:30. [ C ] Patterson hurt his ankle on the opening kickoff.
